data.title: Augur
data.description: Pipeline components for real-time phylodynamic analysis
data.name: augur

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

evidence: "Nextstrain is an open-source project to harness the scientific and public health potential of pathogen genome data." and copyright attributed to specific researchers suggests a research project/lab context.

"Augur is the bioinformatics toolkit we use to track evolution from sequence and serological data. It provides a collection of commands which are designed to be composable into larger processing pipelines." (end-user toolkit / commands)

"Augur is the bioinformatics toolkit we use to track evolution from sequence and serological data." and cited JOSS paper describing phylogenetic analyses of human pathogens (direct analysis of research data).

checks.reason: no binaries found in the repo
checks.name: Binary-Artifacts

documentation.short: Determines if the project has generated executable (binary) artifacts in the source repository.

checks.reason: branch protection is not maximal on development and all release branches
checks.name: Branch-Protection

documentation.short: Determines if the default and release branches are protected with GitHub's branch protection settings.

checks.reason: 13 out of 13 merged PRs checked by a CI test -- score normalized to 10
checks.name: CI-Tests

documentation.short: Determines if the project runs tests before pull requests are merged.

checks.reason: no effort to earn an OpenSSF best practices badge detected
checks.name: CII-Best-Practices

documentation.short: Determines if the project has an OpenSSF (formerly CII) Best Practices Badge.

checks.reason: Found 7/10 approved changesets -- score normalized to 7
checks.name: Code-Review

documentation.short: Determines if the project requires human code review before pull requests (aka merge requests) are merged.

checks.reason: project has 50 contributing companies or organizations
checks.name: Contributors

documentation.short: Determines if the project has a set of contributors from multiple organizations (e.g., companies).
Determines if the project's GitHub Action workflows avoid dangerous patterns.
Determines if the project uses a dependency update tool.

Determines if the project has defined a license.

checks.reason: 30 commit(s) and 9 issue activity found in the last 90 days -- score normalized to 10
checks.name: Maintained

documentation.short: Determines if the project is "actively maintained".
Determines if the project is published as a package that others can easily download, install, easily update, and uninstall.

checks.reason: dependency not pinned by hash detected -- score normalized to 0
checks.name: Pinned-Dependencies

documentation.short: Determines if the project has declared and pinned the dependencies of its build process.

checks.reason: SAST tool is not run on all commits -- score normalized to 0
checks.name: SAST

documentation.short: Determines if the project uses static code analysis.
Determines if the project has published a security policy.

checks.reason: Project has not signed or included provenance with any releases.
checks.name: Signed-Releases

documentation.short: Determines if the project cryptographically signs release artifacts.

checks.reason: detected GitHub workflow tokens with excessive permissions
checks.name: Token-Permissions

documentation.short: Determines if the project's workflows follow the principle of least privilege.
Determines if the project has open, known unfixed vulnerabilities.
